author: excalibur
title: Iran Missile Test A Likely UN Violation
text: Iran Missile Test A Likely UN Violation User Name Current Events Current Events Forum - Latest political news and events 6 Thanks White House: Iran missile test a likely UN violation Quote: There are "strong indications" that Iran violated U.N. Security Council resolutions related to ballistic missiles when it test fired a new missile, the White House said Tuesday . White House press secretary Josh Earnest said that when it comes to Iran's ballistic missile program, "unfortunately, that's not new.""We have seen Iran almost serially violate the international community's concerns about their ballistic missile program," Earnest said. He stressed, however, that those violations are "entirely separate" from the historic nuclear deal reached between Iran and world powers. .... Talent on loan from god Originally Posted by Camelot The Iranian nuclear deal is a DONE DEAL. Get over it already. I agree. I am glad its a deal that is done. I am even more pleased it gets hung around the neck of your party Talent on loan from god Quote: Originally Posted by coke I agree. I am glad its a deal that is done. I am even more pleased it gets hung around the neck of your party Yes, because continuing our Iran policy of the last 35 years that has seen Iran build an entire nuclear program has worked out so well. You assume that everyone is as stupid as you Wingnuts. The world has moved on. They don't seem to give a crap about what you think. You have a bruised ego is all. Quote: Originally Posted by Camelot Yes, because continuing our Iran policy of the last 35 years that has seen Iran build an entire nuclear program has worked out so well. You assume that everyone is as stupid as you Wingnuts. The world has moved on. They don't seem to give a crap about what you think. You have a bruised ego is all. Exactly!! Because when Iran explodes its first nuke, people will remember those 35 years. No one at all will even give a thought to the treaty the socialists of American negotiated to keep it from happening. No one will give that treaty a second thought.
